title: Magnetic field - line integrals and current loop

content.question: A circular ring carries an electric current. The magnetic field diagram shown is in a plane that passes through the center of the ring, and which is perpendicular to the plane of the ring. Four paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, and <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math>, represented by dashed lines, are in the plane of the magnetic field along which the integral <math alttext="the contour integral of vector B dot d vector l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>∮</mo><mover accent="true"><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>⋅</mo><mi>d</mi><mover accent="true"><mi mathvariant="script">l</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> may be evaluated. Which of the paths would yield a result of zero when evaluating this integral?

choices.label: Paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> only

content.answer: Paths <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> only
